name: Hotel Cram

reviews.text: Yes, the Cram Hotel is a very well designed hotel, obvious effort was done as far as the look of the lounge, the corridors are concerned, and really looks like a 4 start hotel. Unfortunately the receptionists are ice cold, they seem they could not care less and you get the impressions you may be bothering them. When you finally get to go up to your room, you arrive into an incredible heat in the corridors. It is like the subway in Paris. The room surprisingly small, although we had reserved a superior room with balcony and view over the city. Upon inquiry, the receptionst coldly explained that they took the liberty to downgrade our reservation, for we opted for a double room. And they do not have double superior rooms, or so he says. The room itself was not to tidy, cracks on the walls, dirt stains, etc. The thing advertised as swimming pool on the roof is hardlw one. It is rather a bath for birds. The expensive breakfast has nothing to do with the quality expected from a 4 star establishment, very boring, but at least the staff here is very friendly.
reviews.title: could be a lot better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at Hotel Cram for five nights and it was superb. The hotel is very contemporary, well designed and very clean. The rooms are compact, larger if facing the "diagonal", but have clever storage which makes it very comfortable. The AC, shower, lighting, etc all work very well. The glass french doors make the rooms virtually soundproof and the room-darkening window treatments make sleeping a joy. The breakfasts are fresh, ample and offered until 11:00 am each morning. The beds are very comfortable and the location is very convenient to all the sites in Barcelona, particularly Gaudi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite all that I would hesitate to recommend this hotel. Although some of the staff members were really helpful and nice, others were the exact opposite and my overall impression of the service is negative. For example, it was my birthday while there and my partner got me a birthday cake and surprised me with it in the room. To our amazement however, room service and then reception refused to bring us some plates and forks to eat it unless we ordered some food. We were told it was against 'hotel policy' to provide plates!!! Breakfast was nothing less than chaotic and frankly a nightmare. The staff were completely disinterested and we felt like we were disturbing them. One morning there was no coffee / juice / milk until 20 minutes after we arrived.

reviews.title: Thumbs Up For The Cram
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to return to Barcelona after a great trip last year, but rather than rent an apartment again (which had it's pitfalls), we elected to try a hotel for a change. After reading various reviews, my wife seemed set on the Cram although were disappointed to find many online booking companies said the hotel was full. She contacted the hotel directly on the off-chance and to our delight they confirmed they did indeed have a room free and charged roughly the same rate as was being suggested through third-party companies...this might be worth remembering.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the AeroBus from the airport to Placa Catalunya, firstly based on cost (4 Euros each) and also that our hotel seemed close to this area on the map. We obviously got our map-reading wrong as it was a good 15 minute walk (mostly uphill it seemed!) to the Cram from the bus drop-off point and it seemed worse in 25 degrees heat carrying bags and suitcases. In hindsight, we would now have got a cab. But, albeit a little sweaty, we made it to the Cram and were delighted with the cheerful welcome and helpful staff. The hotel looks and feels very high quality as soon as you step inside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have recently been upgraded technology wise and now feature a PC-based communication and entertainment system that is clearly impressive. Via the 32" wall mounted LCD TV, you have movies on-demand, full internet access via a wireless keyboard, about 30 Spanish tv-channels (plus CNN/BBC), Barcelona guides and history all on-screen and even some music choices to set the scene for you. Better still, all of this was included in our room rate with no additional charges for any aspect, even the movies.
reviews.title: Great Experience but Couple of Small Flaws

likes.liked: — The modern design and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, a warning. The system is new and is experiencing teething problems presently. In room 209, the wireless keyboard didn't work (no internet), the TV kept freezing up and when it did work, half the screen was fuzzy. We pointed this out and the staff were so helpful, finding us another room to move to where everything worked adequately, but we still experienced a few issues. Also, there are several hard-core XXX movies available in the movie-list to watch and although we eventually saw a parental lock-out facility, it wasn't apparent initially and could easily be overlooked....if you take children, be very careful. We're not prudes, but couldn't resist a quick look at these movies and even we were mildly shocked!! :-)

description: Hotel Cram is situated in the middle of the Example district of Barcelona very close to the Paseo de Gracia, Rambla de Cataluña, Plaza de Cataluña and the Ramblas.Surrounded by the cities most emblematic architecture, the hotel fits perfectly into this rich legacy. The modernist style façade dates back to 1892, and has a definite majestic elegance.The 67 rooms are planned to offer maximum comfort, they stand out warm, elegant, avant-garde aesthetic, their highly functional design and their high-tech equipment.The restaurant Angle Barcelona, 1* Michelin, is moving to Hotel Cram and will be opening its doors on June 2013, with the same philosophy and willingness to bring customers a dining experience which is sure to tantalise each one of their senses.If ABaC is the ultimate expression of Jordi Cruz' cuisine, l'Angle seeks to liven up tradition with innovative touches, high quality products and dishes altogether different from those created in the kitchens of ABaC.Attentive, warm and friendly service with common goals: to clearly convey the messages hidden in the actual recipes and define our understanding of gastronomy every day, based on memory, creativity and the best ingredients.The redesign of event and meeting rooms, whose capacities ranges from 2-70 people, placed special emphasis on enhancing light through integrated stained glass windows.The Ànemos Terrace Bar, located on the 7th floor with panoramic views of Barcelona, offers a breakfast buffet from 07:00 to 11:00. It later reopens from 12.00 am until 12.00 pm, serving drinks, appetizers, tapas and 'informal cuisine' uninterruptedly throughout the day. The new menu offers little snapshots of the creative style of Chef Jordi Cruz.
